>The real bad stuff:

>- Malicious or Illegal Software
Do not share information related to illegal or malicious software. We will remove all discussions and comments that include such information. If you would like to report an exploit or hack to us, please send in a support ticket at https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new 
Moderators will look for the following:
Posts about or linking to hacks, exploits, or non-approved 3rd party programs
Posts that link to pirated movies, music, software, etc

>- Boards Ban Evasion
We will permanently suspend accounts of players who: 
Post on another account after receiving a permanent Boards suspension for severe or multiple violations. 
Post on behalf of a player who has received a permanent Boards suspension for severe or multiple violations.

>- Illegal Activities or Drugs
Criminal masterminds, or aspiring criminal masterminds: please don’t talk about your activities or plans on these boards. Posts about illegal activity will be escalated to law enforcement.
Threats
Threats of any kind will be handled differently depending on severity, but all posts of this kind will be removed. Extreme instances will be escalated to the proper authorities.

>- Phishing & Scamming
Moderators will look for the following:
Posts about services claiming to give free RP
Links to cleverly disguised phishing sites

>#Advocating Violations of the Rules
>Moderators will also be on the lookout for players who actively advocate or solicit violations of the Terms of Use or the Boards rules. Players encouraging this sort of behavior may be punished the same as engaging in it themselves.


TL/DR: Advocating Violations of Riot's rules or ToU (including account selling) is a no-no.

You weren't just discussing in-game rule-breaking; you were breaking the rules yourself and encouraging other players to break the rules so you could reap a profit on illegitimate business. Account sharing and account-selling is against the rules, and you should know this.

From the [_ToU, Code of Conduct_](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse#code-conduct)...

> viii. Participating in any action which, in the sole and exclusive judgment of Riot Games, defrauds any other user of the Game, including by scamming or social engineering;
>
> xiii. Playing on another person’s account to “boost” that account’s status or rank; or
> 
> xiv. Inducing or encouraging others to violate this Code of Conduct or the terms of this Agreement.

And, yes, I'd consider it scamming; you're having people pay money for accounts on a free-to-play game, and doubtless you had to have played those accounts yourself in some capacity before selling them off to someone.

From the [_Summoner's Code_](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code)...

> **Keep your account information private.**
>
> Sharing your account information with a friend can cause your account to be stolen for good or draw a ban for negative behaviour you didn’t commit. Logging into third-party sites with your League account information also exposes you to risk of account theft.

While that particular guideline more refers to personal account safety, there's also the unspoken implication that sharing an account (which poses a great enough risk to you already) would warrant a punishment, which goes hand-in-hand with article XIII of the Code of Conduct.

And, of course, snippets from the _Boards Universal Rules._

> **Account, Product, or Service Promotion.**
>
> No advertising product sales, trading, reward programs, or gifting of any kind. No advertising transactional services offered by individuals or companies.
>
> **Phishing or Scamming.**
>
> Do not post content related to free RP or phishing sites.
>
> **Advocating Violations of the Rules.**
>
> Do not post content advocating or soliciting violations of the [Terms of Use](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse), [Summoner’s Code](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code), or Board Rules. Players encouraging this sort of behavior will be punished as if they had engaged in it themselves.

And, yes, while the "Phishing or Scamming" rule explicitly states "free RP" scams, I personally can't count _selling accounts in a F2P game_ as anything _but_ a scam.

When I read that, even if it's followed by mention of discussing that behavior, all it reads as is that you were advertising the accounts you sell.

That said, if your thread was discussing account-selling rather than advertising it, I'd like to know more about that discussion. Typically, Moderators don't take action against threads/comments discussing behavior and rulebreaking unless those threads/comments are actively advocating it.
